intro: Erigeron tucumanensis, commonly known as the Tucumán fleabane, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow ray florets surrounded by tubular disk florets. Erigeron tucumanensis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
